isis.stitle: TSI 97-02-01R - Rockwell Front Steer Axles With Unitized Wheel Hub Assemblies, Navistar Code 02ARK and 02ARL

subjectgroup.subject: Rockwell Front Steer Axles With Unitized Wheel Hub Assemblies, Navistar Code 02ARK and 02ARL

geninfo.para: The subject axles are equipped with unitized wheel hubs that are lubricated (greased) for life. They should not be inspected at pre-delivery for lubricant or bearing end play.
The Rockwell unitized wheel hub can be identified by the threaded grease cap.
The bearings and seals in the unitized wheel hub are not serviceable. The unitized wheel hub must be replaced as an assembly.

svcprocinfo.para: Inspect the unitized wheel hub for end play every 200,000 miles or 24 months.

warning.para: Do not work under a vehicle supported by a jack. Jacks can slip or fall over causing personal injury. Always use safety stands.

step1.para: Set parking brake. Place wheel blocks in front and behind each rear wheel. Place safety stands under the front axle. Raise the front end so that the front wheel is off the ground. Remove the wheel and tire.

note.para: As the unitized wheel hub warms up during operation, a small amount of grease will purge out the outboard dust seal as pressure is released from inside the hub unit. This is normal.

step1.para: Attach a dial indicator with magnetic base to the end of the axle spindle. Place the indicator stem in contact with the wheel pilot on the unitized wheel hub.
Set the dial indicator to zero ("0").
Rotate the wheel in both directions while pushing inward until the dial indicator reading remains constant. Record the reading.
Repeat Step 5 while pulling outward. Record the reading.
The difference between the two readings is end play and should be .003 to .009 inch.
If the end play is out of specification, verify the torque on the inner wheel bearing nut. The tightening specification is 500 to 700 ft-lbs. (678 to 949 Nm) of torque ( Figure 1).
If correct end play cannot be achieved, the unitized wheel hub must be replaced.
